duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide spiritual support and pastoral care to patients and their families, in alignment with hospice philosophy.
Develop and implement bereavement support programs for patients during and after hospice care.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams and external stakeholders to ensure effective spiritual and bereavement support.
Promote and oversee grief counseling and bereavement support activities, including support groups and educational initiatives.
Document care and services provided according to state and federal requirements.

education_certification.credential: Degree in divinity, social sciences, or related field preferred.
Clinical Pastoral Education as required per state regulation.
Certifications, Licenses, and Registrations as required by state.
